statement:
If, for $t_0\leq t\leq t_1$, $\phi(t)\geq 0$ and $\psi(t)\geq 0$ are
continuous functions such that the inequality
$$\phi(t)\leq K+L\int_{t_0}^t \psi(s)\phi(s)ds$$ holds on
$t_0\leq t\leq t_1$, with $K$ and $L$ positive constants, then
$$\phi(t)\leq K\exp\left(L\int_{t_0}^t \psi(s)ds\right)$$ on
$t_0\leq t\leq t_1$.
